meanings.definition: A quantity having direction as well as magnitude, especially as determining the position of one point in space relative to another.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned about vectors and how they show both size and direction.
meanings.sent2: The GPS uses vectors to guide us to our destination accurately.
meanings.sent3: The vectors on the map were like little arrows pointing the way to the treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a vector that led her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful arrows to explain vectors, making it easier to understand.

meanings.definition: An organism, typically a biting insect or tick, that transmits a disease or parasite from one animal or plant to another.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the vectors responsible for spreading the virus.
meanings.sent2: The mosquito is a common vector for malaria.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky vectors carried the illness from one person to another.
meanings.sent4: The tiny mosquito acted as a dangerous vector, passing on the disease.
meanings.sent5: The vectors buzzing around were like tiny messengers of sickness.

meanings.definition: A quantity that has both magnitude and direction, represented by an arrow whose length represents the magnitude and whose direction represents the direction.
meanings.sent1: The physics class discussed how vectors can be represented by arrows.
meanings.sent2: The wind speed and direction can be shown using vectors.
meanings.sent3: The playful vectors on the graph danced in different directions.
meanings.sent4: His ambition was a vector pointing towards his goals.
meanings.sent5: The illustration of vectors made it clear how they combine both size and direction.
